title: CANactions festival
segmentation: Hi my name is Valentina.
I'm the director of connections.
School for men studies now we call like that.
Well, basically it's a platform, the history.
It is 8 year long.
History, basically everything started from several lectures of our friends which we who we brought to Kyiv.
Just, you know, just for fun and for the eight years we became the biggest architectural International Festival in Ukraine.
So it's not like festival fun.
Well of course we had some parties also like our colleague from Poland said that it's very important, but still it's more educational.
Project so in frame of the festival we had many different events from lectures of famous and not very famous European and world leading professionals, mainly architects.
We are lodging the student competition for Ukrainian students.
The prices are enrollment and free master degree study in the southeast of architecture.
So it's going to very popular competition in the.
In frame with festival, we also did several international competitions.
We did several workshops, real case workshops in frame.
The festival of course exhibitions and lecture lectures.
Well, after eight years.
We realize that there should be a new level new step and you all know the events that happened two years ago in Ukraine and still happening, and this was like very big change for us.
Also because like the society.
Is changing and the demand of real professionals in urban?
As for, your conjecture is very needed because our boss Soviet heritage really gonna press us.
Steel is very big and big impact, so we want we decide that all these connections that together through the festival could be.
We could use them and create this postgraduate school institution to prepare the urban managers, the professionals who can who are able to basically the.
To be like than you.
The creators of the GNU Ukrainian cities.
OK, maybe I'll start with it.
So the structure.
It's pretty simple, so we have in public we have in the public program which do which are from September to May.
Around tables, lectures, exhibitions, film, movie screenings, presentations and like in May every May we have this big big festival, the.
Yep, there it is.
Budget program.
So, and it's the festival is an annual and every may and we will have next one in May.
The events are open where we have like it was a private initiative, but now we're gathering so many partners from the embassies to some foundations.
So pretty much everything is free.
Anne.
Yeah so.
Every year we welcome more than like four 4000 people and Family Festival and much more people during the year.
We also launched the masterclasses for in different spheres architecture, urban planning project management.
Well, very, very different.
Directions that could be useful in city in city Veloppement.
From this September to December we are having free three very cool workshops which were listed for by very interesting people.
So anyone who want can apply and take part in it.
And now I ask program Director of Connection School for massage.
Ladies love to Minsky tell you a little bit about the program of the school.
Who are the students?
What is the idea?
How it works?
Yeah yeah, thank you Father, we've decided to break the system and present our initiative together.
Yeah, so basically I'm responsible for these beautiful parts which we called studios and it's the core of the new branch of Connections movement.
It's about the school.
It's about education and it's about some new format of specialists for Ukraine.
And like we're extremely excited about this.
Part so try and I will try to explain what we actually are doing.
Yeah, here you can see some key facts about the program.
We called our course studio and the duration of each studio is 3 1/2 months.
Yeah, it's quite intensive full time and watch what is important interdisciplinary course and the amount of our students is like 1618.
Now we have 18 people and speaking about our students who are basically not the students because almost all of them have.
Great experience of being a part of some urban projects.
Being initiative initiators of their own projects or like collaborating with the international institutions in frame of Urban Development.
So basically they're skilled there.
Very ambitious and like it was, to be honest, it was some kind of experiment for us.
Could we find even such amount of.
People who can shape the knew forms and not just the forms but what is important.
The content of Ukrainian cities and the answer was yes.
Yeah, so we have developed a two year program which includes four studios.
Now we're in I think in the middle of the first one the topic of the first one from general plan to guiding plans, strategic strategic tools for Urban Development.
So basically I'd like to say that it's very important issue in Ukraine in terms of reform of decentralisation and very public.

Natural thing is thinking for some new forms of Urban Development, so all of us believe that today our country have a chance to change this system of decision making to change this system of Urban Development like from education, we've decided to push this process forward.
In February, we are starting the second studio, which will be focused on quite the opposite topic and will cover problems of postindustrial cities development.
But what is important?
We are not going to work just on Urban Development, but also.
Try to discover such hidden topic as small cities and rural regions.
Development of Ukraine.

That's basically the topic of this art studio and like our ambition, is to end these like course urbanism you a restart with the overview of urbanization and realization of Ukraine in terms of the whole country.
In the end, in frame of the first studio.
Yeah, so some key facts about the second studio.
What is important that we are not just about architecture.
Our students have very different backgrounds from mighty specialists, designers, sociologists are urban economix economists to basically architects and urban planners.
We are real case oriented.
That means that for us is very important not to become a theoretical platform, but also to.
Work on some real cases to work with the content context, which is unusual for education in I would say post Soviet countries and another one very important issue is basically communication.
We are going to communicate with the results of our work with the wider public to promote our ideas through lectures or presentations by our students.
By by our experts, and I think this participation in future a photo to our platform is very good.
Change the chance for us to share basically the results of our work over the world.
And thank you for.
These for this possibility, yeah, and one more very important issue for our school.
It basically what's after what's afterwards?
Because like after Gradiation, the University of Ukraine is a big question.
Where to go then and we now working on creation the network with different kind of partners, which is not just architectural institutions but also city councils.
Ministry of Regional and Regional Development.

Some interdisciplinary research institutions not just in Ukraine but also all over the world and like for us, I think it's very important to include also the alumnae of connection school to basically our team.
Yeah, so thank you very much for the possibility to begin with.
You'll yeah looking forward.
Thank you.
